 * @file    USART/Interrupt_FIFO/readme.txt
 * @version V2.00
 * @date    2020-02-27
 * @brief   Description of USART FIFO example.
Example Description:

This example shows how to configure USART as interrupt mode and use FIFO to send and receive data.

The PCLK_USART frequency is equal to CK_AHB. The USART is configured as 8-bit Word length, one stop bit, no parity and baud rate is set to 115200 bps.

The example sends the Hello string first and wait for Rx to receive 5 data, then loop back Rx data to Tx for the test. When Tx data ready, the example enables the TXDE interrupt and move data from the buffer to the USART FIFO by IRQHandler when TXDE interrupt is triggered. After all the data has been transmitted, the IRQHandler disables the TXDE interrupt.

Besides, the RXDR interrupt is enabled after USART initialization. The RXDR interrupt is triggered when the Rx FIFO level is reached. The example moves the Rx data from the USART FIFO to the buffer by the IRQHandler.

Directory Contents:
  • USART/Interrupt_FIFO/main.c Main program
  • USART/Interrupt_FIFO/ht32fxxxxx_nn_it.c Interrupt handlers
  • USART/Interrupt_FIFO/ht32_board_config.h Board configuration file
Hardware and Software Environment:
  • This example can be run on the HT32 series development kit.
  • Refer "ht32_board_config.h" for pin assignment.
  • You need a terminal software such as TeraTerm (https://ttssh2.osdn.jp/).
  • Connect a null-modem female/female RS232 cable between the UxART and PC serial port. Terminal configuration:
    • Word Length = 8 Bits
    • One Stop Bit
    • No parity
    • BaudRate = 115200 baud
    • Flow control: None
